documents.document: @bryanbossin I believe it's record within their division
@RaptorsTalk_ I think you can offer Carroll and/or Sullinger to teams until you're blue in the face and it's unlikely to net you anything
@christodafur @Young_Baker911 @Jay_Blue24 No, they dont want to give them away. Outside of DeRozan/Lowry hard to imagine anyones untradeable
@daveL9293 You still want that tiebreaker. Who knows what the standings will look like at the end of the season, could be important
@Young_Baker911 @Jay_Blue24 I think they'd like to do something but can't will a player onto the market. As always, depends what's out there
@Jay_Blue24 Well, if nothing else, we should have a better idea of who they are by then (All-Star break to get healthy + trade deadline)
@gnganinja You can do anything you put your mind to, I'm told.
ESPN has picked up Celtics/Raptors on Feb 24 (now at 8pm). Big game. It'll be the 4th & final meeting between them, could determine tiebreak
Encouraging sign for a team in desperate need of encouraging signs. https://t.co/lC9hBJbpuG
HOME COURT VIDEO: Jack Armstrong weighs in on the battle for backup PG minutes and the struggling DeMarre Carroll… https://t.co/rEDTkFkR8D
HOME COURT VIDEO: Raptors 905 asst David Gale decodes the enigmatic T-Ross, who he worked closely with this summer… https://t.co/ISiBItKMHU
HOME COURT VIDEO: Raptors 905 asst @Dgale14 on how D-League is helping VanVleet & the young guys prepare for the NB… https://t.co/ByjR6EgcM4
HOME COURT VIDEO: How high is our level of concern with the Raptors right now? Are we pushing the panic button?… https://t.co/tfHwxLCLG3
@BlakeMurphyODC @TSN1050Radio That would qualify under the "9-10" option on the panic scale in our other poll.
BONUS @TSN1050Radio poll question: Who should get the first crack at backup point guard minutes for the Raptors next week? #TSNHomeCourt
Our @TSN1050Radio Home Court poll: From 1-10, what's your level of panic for the Raptors right now (1=no panic, 10=full panic) #TSNHomeCourt
@lowe_jeff Yes, the show will be podcasted after. Available online or on iTunes (I believe)
Don't miss Home Court from 2-4pm @TSN1050Radio today. Raptors 905 assistant coach @Dgale14 joins @meghanmcpeak @DuaneWatson & myself at 2:30
@harpreetsachdev Well, their D was slumping when they were winning. Their offence has dropped off, at least in part because of the injuries
Lowry with DeRozan: 37.2 minutes per game, without: 41.0 Lowry with DeRozan: 24.4 usage %, without: 29.3
@ericwilson778 That's a TSN turning point if I've seen one! haha
Raptors, who are 5th in scoring on season, are the only NBA team averaging fewer than 100 pts over last 10 gms. 43% FG (29th), 30% 3P (last)
For what its worth (I dont know how much that is, btw): Raps have been w/o DeRozan or Patterson in 7 of the 8 losses over this 10-gm stretch
@GirlWonder3 Will be interesting when he's back, I do think Norm has earned a role but I understand why they've managed it the way they have
@MR_Malice14 I think they feel VanVleet has earned the 3rd spot. Whether Delon is 100% or not, he probably has to re-earn their trust.
@GirlWonder3 Thats exactly how they've used Norm but tough to give him consistent role while also trying to get something out of Ross/DC
@moubyoussuf22 They were so used to winning games with their O so the D is still up & down, as it has been, only the O isnt bailing them out
@GirlWonder3 I'd start giving FVV/DW a look but how quickly were they supposed to turn their back on Joseph after how good he was last year?
@GirlWonder3 Because there are better players ahead of them. Cant change rotation every time someone has a bad night. Chemistry is important
@moubarakyoussuf Whether you/we panic or not, won't change anything. This will be a very telling 3-week stretch for the organization
@MR_Malice14 We'll see what happens but Id continue to ride hot hand at that position. If Joseph's not giving it to you FVV & DW are capable
@tdotsfinest97 Yep, exactly.
@GirlWonder3 Who haven't they utilized well?
@PhoenixGolf55 Coincidence. He's not exactly helping them wins games but it's not like he's the reason they're losing.
@NickyMac55 Their smart enough to know that doesnt accomplish anything. Masai knows they need help, but you cant will people onto the market
@KaaJJ Can't have more than 15 on the roster. They have 15 now. Would need to waive a player to sign one.
Raptors had been fortunate with relatively good health in past yrs. Injuries have hit them hard but it happens, theyve gotta figure this out
Joseph hasnt been himself & its hurt the Raps, particularly on D. Credit Casey for sending a message. Pretty sure VanVleet got his attention
Raps best player was a guy we didnt know would play 4 hours ago. Not sure if that says more about how good VanVleet was or how bad rest were
Raptors have lost 8 of their last 10 games, 5 of them vs sub-.500 competition, & are now in 4th place, just 0.5 game ahead of 5th-place ATL
Not easy to win on the road w/o 2 of your 3 most important players, regardless of opponent but, man, Raptors are in a bad place right now
@KaaJJ Not worth letting anyone go for him. He's not the player he once was (injuries/age)
Ankle injury will keep him out for the 6th time in the last 7 games. https://t.co/2xvX7Z1eN6
@Skrizzy_TSN @ScottyMacThinks It's an ass-off! (never mind, that sounds gross)
@mboss2331 Arm strength's always been there but pocket presence has improved. Making smarter/quicker decisions & healthy Julio doesnt hurt
@Skrizzy_TSN @ScottyMacThinks I'm more of a Michael Turner guy. Burner had the biggest caboose in the NFL
@ScottyMacThinks Lifelong? No. But the jersey's 6-7 years old and my fandom dates back to the Vick era so I'm not bandwagoning!
@ScottyMacThinks You're looking for Falcons fans, I hear? https://t.co/OcpZZz8UN9
@BlakeMurphyODC I've noticed guys are often not expecting his passes (particularly the other bigs)
@bballfan22 It's the Clippers pick in this upcoming (2017) draft.
@BrianRay88 @InquisitrSports @theinquisitr Please note: this is not a "trade rumour", it's speculation that does not cite an actual source
Sterner's a coaching lifer but, man, if he ever wanted to give the media thing a go he'd make a rock star analyst. He's an elite radio guest
TV Tom Sterner not pulling punches on @OverDrive1050 today: "Terrence had a pathetic game last night. He was awful" https://t.co/Lf0sJtHCW5
3pt contest field: Klay Thompson (defending), Kyle Lowry, Eric Gordon, Kyrie Irving, CJ McCollum, Kemba Walker, Wesley Matthews, Nick Young
No LaVine/Gordon rematch in the dunk-off and there's a dude in there that's played 11 NBA minutes, so get excited!
@RoshaneIngram I've seen him put on shooting displays doing similar drills to the contest in practice. He can hold his own
Not unrelated: Lowry is 5 three-pointers away from passing Morris Peterson for most threes made in Raptors franchise history (801)
Here's what I wrote in Dec on the evolution of the 3pt shot in Lowry's game. It's become a big part of what he does: https://t.co/NFT9TEgwrD
Lowry had told us he wasn't planning on doing the 3pt contest again, glad he changed his mind. Has become one of th… https://t.co/zWvkuJQe4A
What the Kings and Suns got in return for Isaiah Thomas: Alex Oriakhi, trade exception, Marcus Thornton, future (late) 1st-round draft pick
Isaiah Thomas was drafted 60th, traded for little-nothing twice & has made $16M over 5yr career - less than 45 players will make this season
How many Cs had more value than Hibbert 5 yrs ago? You could count them on 1 hand. Now, he & Spencer Hawes get you Miles Plumlee, apparently
@BlakeMurphyODC Bruno and the Raptors' next 8 first-round picks for Boogie. Who says no?
@Jay_Blue24 Easier said than done. You think if I gave you a few million $ you'd stop caring what was said about you? Its human nature
@Jay_Blue24 That wasn't my point. I'm not arguing the validity of the list, I'm saying they're human not robots. They get offended too
@Jay_Blue24 They're still human. If you were DeRozan & SI ranked you 46th you don't think that would add fuel to your fire, for example?
@HD_85 Not eligible because he coached All Star last year. NBA doesn't allow same guy to coach back to back seasons
Meanwhile, Isaiah Thomas had 19 of his 44 points in the 4th quarter. He's a legit MVP candidate
Raptors are in Orlando Friday, in Brooklyn Sunday. Celtics are at home to the Lakers Friday, Clippers on Sunday.
Celtics take 1.5 lead over Raptors for 2nd place. Coach of the team in 2nd after Sunday's games will coach East All-Stars
Raptors fought hard & were right there in tough situation (no DeRozan, 2nd night of b2b) but tough to overcome 14/25 from line, 8/31 from 3
Lowry had never scored 30+ points in 3 consecutive games until yesterday. He's now done it in 4 straight. Has 32 and counting tonight
Isaiah Thomas gives the Celtics their first lead of the night with 4.5 mins left in the game, because of course. He has 9 points in the 4th
Oh, the things Masai might say about Boston ahead of their 2nd-round series.
@ByTimReynolds Yep - The Hawks are screwed.
This Lowry/Joseph/Powell/Ross/Bebe lineup is having some... uhh... difficulty rebounding.
Reminder: Isaiah Thomas leads the NBA in 4th-quarter scoring at 10.3. Lowry ranks 3rd (7.9) with Westbrook in between
Raptors go into the 4th up by 8 points. Would be one of their biggest wins of the season, all things considered, if they can close it out
The Raptors - an 81% free throw shooting team (4th in NBA) - are 12-for-21 from the stripe tonight. Still, their lead is 13 late in Q3
@drake1234566 foul trouble (has 3)
Doesnt happen often but in 2nd night of b2b on road was crucial for Raptors to start strong tonight. They did just that. 62-51 halftime lead
@papergirlannie @Biyombonesaw Statistically he grades as one of the worst regular rotation PGs on D this season
Jared Sullinger in first 6 games with Raptors: 20 points, 8/32 FG in 77 minutes. So far tonight: 10 points, 4/5 FG in 10 minutes. Sure.
@papergirlannie @Biyombonesaw He's getting a pass from a lot of folks but having a bad season. Big reason for team's regression on D
@Biyombonesaw Thomas scored most of his 16 first-quarter points against Joseph. Was torched last night by Holiday too
Raptors bench in 15.5 minutes tonight: 19 points. Raptors bench in 53 minutes last night: 19 points
Raps had little success v Holiday until putting Norm on him. He's the only guy Id feel even somewhat comfortable throwing @ Thomas right now
Raptors had 15 bench pts in 1st Q (Sully with 7!). They had 19 in 4 Qs + OT last night. Thomas with 16 of Boston's 28 pts - he's ridiculous
Bebe joins JV on the bench with 2 fouls so Poeltl checks in and, in a game like this, may have 2 fouls by the time I hit send on this tweet
Not a surprise to see Sully tonight, especially with Raps still watching Pat's mins. Casey's always believed guys get up vs their old teams
After 2 DNP-CDs over last 3 gms, Sullinger checks in vs his former team. He's had some big games in this matchup, with the other jersey on
2 early fouls on Valanciunas - at least one of the highly questionable variety. Bebe replaces him.
Casey's been staggering Pat's mins, still using him w/ 2nd unit but, oddly, the famed Lowry+bench unit is -14 in 44 mins over the last 5 gms
Raptors starters with Patterson are a team-best +90 this season. The version w/ Powell in DeRozan's spot is +19 in 41 mins over last 5 games
Patrick Patterson has played 246 reg season games with the Raptors over 4 years. He's never started 5 straight... until tonight.
One more note from those first 2 meetings vs Boston: Raptors bench got outscored 68-35. They were bested 39-19 vs New Orleans last night
Lowry and DeRozan scored 57% of Toronto's points in those 2 games (123 of 215), including 82 in the 2nd halves. Reminder: no DeRozan tonight
Raptors trailed by 8 and 9 points at halftime in the first 2 meetings vs Boston, held Celtics to 35% & outscored them 127-95 in 2nd halves
@ekoreen #whynobruno
@PhoenixGolf55 Well, yeah, like with almost any stat context is important but his usage is similar & he's playing with similar lineups
